recent_posts.title: Fwd:  Blinded 2-party Musig2
recent_posts.summary:
- In a conversation, @Jonas suggests verifying previous challenges to mitigate potential attacks on statechains.
- @Jonas explains that verifying previous challenges is important to prevent potential attacks on statechains.
- Wagner's attack involves selecting R2 values to manipulate the sum of c values in statechains.

recent_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions".
recent_posts.summary:
- Spam attacks on the Bitcoin network using inscriptions are a topic of debate.
- Blocking inscriptions without addressing larger issues like IBD time and UTXO size may not be effective.
- Standardization options and patch solutions have limitations, requiring a comprehensive approach.

recent_posts.title: Denial of Service using Package Relay
recent_posts.summary:
- Alice raised safety concerns about accepting unconfirmed inputs, which can invalidate coinjoin transactions.
- She advised that coordinator B should not accept zero-fee unconfirmed UTXO and explained potential attacks.
- Additionally, she discussed the benefits of package relay and upcoming RBF proposals for enhancing coinjoin security.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- A scheme for creating a `keysend` protocol that allows multipath payments was proposed.
- The `keysend` is split into multiple parts to ensure the receiver can claim the payment only when all parts arrive.
- The receiver can determine support for multipath `keysend` by observing the behavior when a part reaches.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- Our team has recorded and transcribed specification meetings since the beginning of the year.
- You can now access these transcripts at [https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification].
- Chaincode's Gurwinder has played a crucial role in reviewing and ensuring the accuracy of these transcripts.

recent_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
recent_posts.summary:
- Participants discussed Bitcoin network policies and proposed solutions to address issues.
- The concept of zero-fee transactions, lightning unilateral closes, and trimmed HTLCs were discussed.
- A hybrid approach to channel jamming mitigation involving monetary measures was proposed.

active_posts.title: Standardisation of an unstructured taproot annex
active_posts.summary:
- The taproot annex is being considered for standardization as a Type-Length-Value (TLV) format.
- For immediate use, the proposal suggests allowing non-structured annexes starting with '0'.
- This approach provides flexibility, efficiency, and the potential for future structure improvements.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of a "blinded" server for statechains is discussed, preventing certain information leakage.
- Blinded statechains rely on trusting the server's reported number of signatures for a key.
- The 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 protocol involves key and nonce aggregation to generate a final signature.

active_posts.title: On the experiment of the Bitcoin Contracting Primitives WG and marking this community process "up for grabs"
active_posts.summary:
- Last year, a new community process was introduced to specify covenants, addressing consensus issues.
- Initiatives included the bitcoin-inquisition fork and archiving covenant proposals under Optech.
- Though the author focused on Lightning development, they encouraged others to continue covenant efforts.

active_posts.title: HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
active_posts.summary:
- The email updates on channel jamming and provides details for the next call on May 1st.
- The group plans to gather data on HTLC endorsement and reputation tracking for jamming mitigation.
- They propose a reputation scheme and outline minimal changes required to add HTLC endorsement.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- The LNbits team discovered an exploit in invoice handling that allowed attackers to create balances.
- LNbits version 0.10.5 patches the exploit and users are advised to update.
- The attack highlights the need for awareness and precautions in Lightning applications.

active_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
active_posts.summary:
- Blinded paths in the Lightning Network offer privacy, but restrict payment options.
- "Compliant" nodes may monopolize routing, affecting decentralization and privacy.
- Lightning "chain analysis" could pressure businesses, raising concerns over receiver privacy.
